name: v1.2.3
body:
## What's Changed
* Add seen_by_guid property to feeds for dynamic link feeds by @StormPooper in https://github.com/nning/transmission-rss/pull/131
* Add option to set unlimited seed ratio by @rapperskull in https://github.com/nning/transmission-rss/pull/108
* Optimize docker image as suggested in #97 by @nning in https://github.com/nning/transmission-rss/pull/98 (thanks to @sedlund!)
* Support exclude filters by @jntn-st in https://github.com/nning/transmission-rss/pull/83

## New Contributors
* @StormPooper made their first contribution in https://github.com/nning/transmission-rss/pull/131
* @rapperskull made their first contribution in https://github.com/nning/transmission-rss/pull/108
* @jntn-st made their first contribution in https://github.com/nning/transmission-rss/pull/83

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/nning/transmission-rss/compare/v1.2.2...v1.2.3

name: v1.2.2
body:
## What's Changed
* Fix encoded feed url error (fix #110 #115) by @totorowechat in https://github.com/nning/transmission-rss/pull/125

## New Contributors
* @totorowechat made their first contribution in https://github.com/nning/transmission-rss/pull/125

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/nning/transmission-rss/compare/v1.2.1...v1.2.2

name: v1.2.1
body:
## 1.2.1

[README](https://github.com/nning/transmission-rss/blob/v1.2.1/README.md)

## Changelog

Changes since 1.2.0:

- Fix import of RSS library (fix #118)

name: v1.2.0
body:
## 1.2.0

[README](https://github.com/nning/transmission-rss/blob/v1.2.0/README.md)

## Changelog

Changes since 1.1.0:

- Set "transmission-rss" as User-Agent for aggregator (thanks to @k3s4, see #85)
- Enable syntax highlight in README code blocks (thanks to @PeterDaveHello, see #91)
- Update to Ruby 2.7 on CI and in Docker images
- Explicitly use `URI.open` instead of `Kernel#open` in `Aggregator` (fix #94)
- Fix obsoletion warnings in Ruby 2.7

name: v1.1.0
body:
## 1.1.0

[README](https://github.com/nning/transmission-rss/blob/v1.1.0/README.md)

## Changelog

Changes since 1.0.0:

- Handling unencoded URLs as suggested by @peskdale (fix #71)
- Add TLS option for connection to transmission-daemon (see #74)
- Single run mode contributed by @eyalzek (see #68, #80)
- Improvements on docker image

name: v1.0.0
body:
## 1.0.0 :tada: 

It is about time, transmission-rss gets a major version increase, since it is existing now for over 7 years and I would call it adequately stable in its current form!

## Changelog

Changes since 0.2.6:

- Refactor Log (e.g. allow specifying level, fix #10)
- Pass additional client options (e.g. timeout) to Client
- Make sure, options is not nil in Client (fix #58)
- Do not send download-dir and paused options if not specified in config (fix #53)
- Officially drop support for Ruby < 2.1
- Reset seen file CLI option
- Seen file config fix
- Warn on duplicate urls (fix #67)
- Add possibility to specify UID/GID for docker (fix #69)
- Rake tasks for docker (`rake docker:build` and `rake docker:run`)
- Update dependencies

name: v1.0.0.beta1
body:
## 1.0.0

It is about time, transmission-rss gets a major version increase, since it is existing now for over 7 years and I would call it adequately stable in its current form!

Please test this release thoroughly if you can!

## Changelog

Changes since 0.2.6:

- Refactor Log (e.g. allow specifying level, fix #10)
- Pass additional client options (e.g. timeout) to Client
- Make sure, options is not nil in Client (fix #58)
- Do not send download-dir and paused options if not specified in config (fix #53)
- Officially drop support for Ruby < 2.1
- Reset seen file CLI option
- Seen file config fix
- Warn on duplicate urls (fix #67)
- Add possibility to specify UID/GID for docker (fix #69)
- Rake tasks for docker (`rake docker:build` and `rake docker:run`)
- Update dependencies

name: 1.0.0.alpha1
body:
## 1.0.0

It is about time, transmission-rss gets a major version increase, since it is existing now for over 7 years and I would call it adequately stable in its current form!

Please test this release thoroughly if you can!

## Changelog

Changes since 0.2.6:

- Refactor Log
- Pass additional client options (e.g. timeout) to Client
- Make sure, options is not nil in Client (fix #58)
- Do not send download-dir and paused options if not specified in config (fix #53)
- Officially drop support for Ruby < 2.1

## Changelog

Changes since 0.2.5:

- Fix crash when feeds being specified by URL only (see #52)

## Changelog

Changes since 0.2.4:
- Pull in network-online in systemd unit (see #42)
- Prefix /usr/local to config path on BSDs (see #43)
- Add possibility to deactivate certificate validation (per feed, see #45)

## Contributors

Many thanks to @DasKaktus for the certificate validation option!

## Changelog

Changes since 0.2.3:
- Fix passing of options to Client instance (see #41)

## Changelog

Changes since 0.2.2:
- Updated dependencies
- Correctly pass configured seen file path (see #38)

## Changelog

Changes since 0.2.1:
- Updated dependencies
- Fixed `Client` spec

## Changelog

Changes since 0.2.0:
- Support configuration of seed ratio limit per feed (see #9)

## Changelog

Changes since 0.1.26:
- Add System V init script
- Add systemd unit file
- Allow an array of regular expressions per feed in configuration
- Refactor
- Test Client with mocks
- Add SeenFile class
- Migrate seen file to new path
- Save only hashes of seen URIs
- Make seen file path configurable
- Allow seperate download_path per regular expression
- Handle empty config files (see #26)
- Extract default config into Config class
- Watch for and apply config file changes on Linux
- Add {{server.rpc_path}} option (see #28)
- Add option (-r) to reset the seen file entries upon startup (in a032d36, see #31)

## Contributors

Many thanks to the following contributors!
- khatharr
- @mikz 
- @confiq 
- @rlue 

(And thanks to @sazo for the release hint! :smile:)
Fixed #21.
Possibility to specify download paths (pull request #16).
Fixed #15.
Explicitly decompress HTTP gzip body in Ruby 1.9.3.
Fixed bug that caused crash when running without HOME environment variable set (e.g. from systemd unit under Debian).
Additionally load user config from "$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/transmission-rss/config.yml" as requested in #13.
Support for Ruby >= 1.9.3.
Support for HTTP Basic Authentication.
Filter feed item titles by regular expression.
Redirects from http to https on feed aggregation are followed and URIs are properly encoded.
